definition: tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish

sentences.english: She pressed her child to her heart.
Mothers of the sailors wailed as they clasped their sons’ photos and the urns containing their ashes.
sentences.chinese: 遇难官兵的母亲紧抱孩子照片和骨灰盒，嚎啕恸哭。

sentences.english: She hugged me, and I saw her “we’ll see about that” look.
sentences.chinese: 她紧抱着我，我看见她那“我们等着瞧”的表情。

sentences.english: A woman in the trench is clutching a baby and crying desperately.
sentences.chinese: 地沟中的一名妇女紧抱着她的孩子，绝望的哭喊着。

sentences.english: To hug, especially with great force.
sentences.chinese: 紧抱，尤指强有力地拥抱。

sentences.english: Ah, I hug this pride in the secret of my heart.
sentences.chinese: 呵，我在我心的微隐处紧抱着这一段骄荣。

sentences.english: This time, swaddling my daughter in her fuzzy blanket and holding her close to my chest.
sentences.chinese: 这次我把她裹在毛茸茸的毯子里，紧抱在胸前。

sentences.english: They clung together when the time came to part.
sentences.chinese: 分别的时候到了，他们紧抱着不肯分开。

sentences.english: His heart was filled with sadness, and he put his arms around the cow's neck.
sentences.chinese: 他心中悲伤逾恒，用双臂紧抱着她的颈子。

sentences.english: Her left arm holds atablet with the date July 4th, 1776.
sentences.chinese: 左臂紧抱着的书板上刻着1776年7月4日的字样。

sentences.english: Andie hugged her doll tightly to her chest.
sentences.chinese: 安蒂将她的洋娃娃紧抱在胸前。

sentences.english: He squeezed her to his breast and calmed her down.
sentences.chinese: 他把她紧抱在怀中，使她安静下来。

sentences.english: The child is hugging her doll.
sentences.chinese: 那小孩紧抱着她的洋娃娃。

sentences.english: She held her child in a loving clasp .
sentences.chinese: 她钟爱地紧抱着她的孩子。

sentences.english: I hold her hands press her to my breast.
sentences.chinese: 我拉起她的手，把她紧抱在胸前。

sentences.english: It is heroic to hug one's sorrow and determine not to be consoled.
sentences.chinese: 紧抱自己的悲伤，决心不去接受抚慰，这有多勇敢。

definition: to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to relinquish one's grip/to let go
to fasten tightly with a hoop
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
